newsitem.title: USA: Dow industrials extend gains, NYSE sets curbs.
newsitem.headline: Dow industrials extend gains, NYSE sets curbs.

text.p: U.S. blue chip stocks extended early morning gains, optimistic about the upcoming earnings reporting period, while technology stocks also rose.
The Dow Jones Industrial Average was up around 45 points, or 0.58 percent, at 7904. Its rise prompted the New York Stock Exchange to set curbs on index arbitrage trading.
Nasdaq also strengthened, gaining around four points, or 0.28 percent, at 1475. On Monday, technology stocks climbed higher despite choppy declines in the broader market.
The long bond was down 6/32 at a 6.59 percent yield.
